Module miranda.c482retry
Package miranda.c482retry

Class AddProductController

java.lang.Object
miranda.c482retry.AddProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The AddProductController class controls the behavior of the Add Product form in the Inventory Management System.

  • Method Details

    • onActionSaveAddProduct

      public void onActionSaveAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the "Save Product" button is clicked. Validates input fields, checks for errors, and adds a new product to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the "Save Product" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an I/O error while loading the main form.

    • onActionAddAssocPart

      public void onActionAddAssocPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Adds a selected part to the list of associated parts for the product.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the "Add" button.

    • onActionRemoveAssocPart

      public void onActionRemoveAssocPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Removes a selected associated part from the list of associated parts for the product.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the "Remove" button.

    • onActionSearchPartId

      public void onActionSearchPartId(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Searches for a part by its ID or name and updates the parts table with the search results.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the "Search" button.

    • onActionDisplayMainForm

      public void onActionDisplayMainForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches to the main form view when the "Display Main Form" button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking the "Display Main Form" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an I/O error while loading the main form.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. This method is called automatically by JavaFX.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
